title: Large-Scale Advanced ECMO Nursing Board Game-Based Training Course: Patient Safety and Clinical Protocol Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic critical care nursing and ECMO equipment comprehension, familiarity with clinical protocol structures, and awareness of medical ethics and patient safety principles
context.additional_context: Establishes an interactive learning environment using digital devices. Conducts team-based projects applying real ICU scenarios. Simulation designs reflect clinical practice guidelines and patient safety protocols within medical institutions.

learning_goals: Explain the physiological principles of ECMO equipment and critical care management procedures with 90% accuracy, and present clinical application procedures based on patient safety protocols.

In board game simulations, accurately diagnose high-risk ECMO complications (e.g., hemorrhage, thrombosis, infection) with at least 85% accuracy, and establish response plans according to clinical protocols.

Through team-based PBL projects, learners draft an ECMO patient management protocol, develop a final protocol (approximately 10 pages) incorporating at least three core procedures (e.g., blood flow monitoring, anticoagulation management, infection prevention) with feedback from clinical experts, achieve a suitability score of 80% or higher in institutional clinical simulation evaluations, and reflect medical ethics and patient rights protection principles.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
